newsArray.title: Cricket-Bangladesh meet with ICC to request relocation of T20 World Cup matches
newsArray.description: Jan 17 (Reuters) - The ‌Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) has had "constructive" discussions with the ‌International Cricket Council (ICC) over moving their Twenty20 World ‌Cup matches from India to Sri Lanka, the country's governing body said on Saturday. Read full story
creator: the star online

newsArray.title: Bangladesh Makes BIZARRE Request To ICC To Avoid Coming To India For T20 World Cup 2026
newsArray.description: A delegation from the ICC went to Bangladesh to find a solution to the Bangladesh-India T20 World Cup 2026 impasse. As a solution, BCB asked to switch groups with Ireland to avoid matches in India.
creator: shaunak ghosh

newsArray.title: Chinnaswamy Stadium cleared to host IPL and international matches again
newsArray.description: The M Chinnaswamy Stadium in Bengaluru has been cleared to host IPL and international matches again after months of suspension following the 2025 stampede tragedy. KSCA assured compliance with safety measures, while RCB’s IPL 2026 home venue remains under discussion
creator: ians

newsArray.title: Pakistan Television breaks 232-year old cricket record as it defends 40-run target against SNGPL
newsArray.description: article author: APAuthor: Associated PressID: 1768657668036666300Sat, 2026-01-17 19:16ISLAMABAD: A 232-year-old record in first-class cricket was broken Saturday when Pakistan Television successfully defended a 40-run target against Sui Northern Gas Pipeline Limited.SNGPL, which was led by Pakistan test captain Shan Masood and included several other international cricketers, was bowled out for 37 to lose the four-day President’s Trophy game against PTV by two runs at Karachi.Main category: SportCricketTags: PakistanCricketShan MasoodPakistan Television
creator: rbksa

newsArray.title: Will Virat Kohli score his 85th International century? Here's a look at his ODI record in Indore
newsArray.description: Virat Kohli 2.0 has truly arrived. After his unbeaten 74 against Australia in Sydney, the Indian batting star has not looked back. He carried that rich vein of form into the home series against South Africa in November–December, where his two centuries sent a clear message that the ‘King’ had rediscovered his peak prowess.Kohli's resurgence in international cricket has reignited discussions around milestones, records and match-winning knocks.Riding on his batting excellence, the 37-year-old went on to reclaim the top spot in the ICC ODI rankings, replacing Rohit Sharma as the world’s number one ODI batter. His rise was sealed by a match-winning 93 off 91 balls in the first ODI at Vadodara, an innings that powered India to a successful chase of a 300-plus target against New Zealand.Also Read: Virat Kohli reclaims No.1 spot in ODI rankings after 4 long yearsNumbers That Tell the StoryKohli’s recent ODI scores make for impressive reading,74*, 135, 102, 65*, and 93 culminating his prowess with the bat. As India prepare to face New Zealand in a crucial ODI at Indore with the series finely poised at 1–1, all eyes are once again on Kohli and the possibility of his 85th international century.Indore: A Rare BlipDespite his stellar form, Kohli’s ODI record at Indore’s Holkar Stadium is modest by his standards. In four innings at the venue, he has scored 99 runs at an average of 33 and a strike rate of 108.79, with a highest score of 36. His knocks include 23* against West Indies in 2011, 12 against South Africa in 2015, 28 versus Australia in 2017, and 36 against New Zealand in January 2023.While Indore has not been Kohli’s happiest hunting ground, its reputation as a batting-friendly venue offers fresh opportunity. With the series on the line and confidence sky-high, Kohli will be keen to rewrite his Indore story and perhaps add another historic century to his glittering career.
creator: bibhu prasad ray

newsArray.title: ‘My life was taken out of my hands’ – Australia cricket icon was given 50% chance of surviving and placed into a coma
newsArray.description: AN AUSTRALIAN cricket icon was given a 50-50 chance of survival and admitted: "My life was taken out of my hands." Damien Martyn, 54, was diagnosed with meningitis after falling ill on Boxing Day. The infection causes inflammation of the membranes around the brain and spinal cord. It can result in headaches, fever, muscle or...
creator: joshua jones

newsArray.title: எங்களை "பி" குரூப்பிற்கு மாற்றி இலங்கையில் விளையாட வையுங்கள்: ஐசிசி-க்கு வங்கதேசம் வேண்டுகோள்
newsArray.description: வீரர்களின் பாதுகாப்பு காரணத்தால் இந்தியா வர வங்கதேசம் அச்சம் தெரிவித்துள்ளது.ஐசிசி குழு வங்கதேச கிரிக்கெட் போர்டு உடன் பேச்சுவார்த்தை நடத்தி வருகிறது.

newsArray.title: U19 World Cup: India, Bangladesh captains refuse handshake at toss
newsArray.description: India and Bangladesh captains skip handshake at U19 World Cup toss, sparking attention. Bangladesh Cricket Board clarifies it was unintentional, emphasizing sportsmanship. Discover the full story behind this unexpected moment.

newsArray.title: TCA urges BCCI to stop HCA’s Telangana T20 League
newsArray.description: The Telangana Cricket Association has sought BCCI intervention against the Hyderabad Cricket Association’s plan to organise the Telangana T20 Premier League. TCA alleged violations of the BCCI Constitution and demanded the scrapping of HCA’s Governing Council, citing pending court cases
keywords: board of control for cricket in india (bcci)
creator: telangana today
